data.name: Hidden Right Triangles
data.description:
TASK:

  Given a triangle of any type with side lengths a, b, and c, there will be a right triangle formed with the median being the hypotenuse and the altitude or height being a leg. Find the other leg of the right triangle. If the triangle is invalid, return -1.
``` 
          A
         /|\`
        / |h\m `
side b /  |e \e   ` side c
      /   |i  \d     `
     /    |g   \i       `
    /     |h    \a        `
  B/______|t_____\n__________`.C
          {-----}side a
```
Link: https://www.cut-the-knot.org/triangle/ahamaP.jpg

This photos shows a triangle with vertices A, B, and C. A is opposite of side a.


NOTE:

  However, if it is an isosceles triangle **with the base a**, the median and the altitude will be the same. Return zero in that instance. Side a will always be the base and the angle in which the median and altitude intercects is opposite of a. In other words the altitude and the median both touch a.

EXAMPLES:
```
med_height(7, 6, 3) returns 1.9285714285714284
med_height(6, 6, 6) returns 0
med_height(2, 6, 3) returns -1
med_height(9, 6, 5) returns 0.6111111111111102
med_height(17, 29, 31) returns 3.5294117647058907
```
